history.text: Hi, have you ever seen the movie the blindside?
Can I ask you the same question? Have you seen this movie? It came out in 2009.
Yes, it is a very good movie, I enjoyed it very much.
Seems like it's a feel good move based on a book.
Looks very encouraging. To go from poverty to NFL stardoom by someone encouraging you is awesome!
Yes, it is very inspirational to me.
I wonder why Rotten Tomatoes only gave it 69%?
Should have scored higher.
Also anything Sandra Bullock stars in will be a top-rated movie (in my humble opinion):)
Yes, I don't understand that. I thought it had very good acting, and a great story.
I'm don't usually watch sports dramas but this definitely has a plot that would make you step outside the box and view.
*I usually don't
Yes, and it had a very good cast. Sandra Bullock is usually good in anything she does.
For the cast, is that Tim McGraw the singer?
The director does a good job here.
Yes, Tim McGraw is a country singer.
The name is familiar. Nice to see that he uses his talents for more that singing.
*than
Yes, and Quinton Aaron does a good job as playing the football player too...
Stories like this are so good because it show how just by one person showing compassion you can change the entire trajectory of someone life.
That is so true, and definitely illustrated in this movie.
Scene 2 show how you will always have the naysayers. Those that do not support you when you are trying to make a difference.
Oh yes, I remember that now.
So sad that at a young age he was sleeping on couches and going through the foster care system. So many children have to go through these types of situations.  So sad:(
Drugs always in the end seem to be the main culprit.
That's true, I am a teacher and have seen it ruined a lot of lives.
I wonder how many other NFL players may have gone through this same type of situation. Or even on the collegiate level.
There is a good question.

I think I do remember this movie. There were some people that tried to place a racial theme to it which I personally did not agree (gang culture vs suburbs).  However, I personally did not agree. Humans are humans. We can care for each other irrespective of backgrounds.
It's very interesting and synopsis number three, how Michael himself begins to  Question the motives behind the kindness that he is being shown.
So true, I totally agree.

Sometimes people do not know how to process when someone is genuinely being kind when all they have ever dealt with are people with ulterior motives.  I am sure that might have been the reason he ran away from some of the foster families.
Yes, that is probably true. Thanks for the chat, this is been very interesting.
Definitely, you take care! Had a great time discussing The Blind Side!

uid2response.feedback: Thank you, it was a lot of fun.
